newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends higher on Sparks, spillover.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends higher on Sparks, spillover.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures settled higher on commercial buying, spillover support from CBOT soybeans and news that Sparks Companies lowered its estimate of spring wheat acreage, traders said.
Memphis-based Sparks Companies pegged 1997 U.S. spring wheat plantings at 18.59 million acres, down from its previous estimate of 20.312 million.
"We opened firmer. We saw good commercial buying all the way round and we never looked back," a trader said.
Wheat drew support from beans, which ended sharply higher on ideas Brazil will impose an export tax on soybeans.
MGE spring wheat settled 5-1/4 to 7-1/2 cents per bushel higher, with May up 5-1/4 cents at $4.02-3/4. New crop September settled up 5-1/2 cents at $3.85-3/4.
The Minneapolis Grain Exchange estimated spring wheat volume at 23.25 million bushels, up from Thursday's volume of 20.56 million.
In options trade, brokers reported Continental sold 100 $4.00 May spring wheat straddles at 22 cents when the May futures contract reached $4.00-1/2.
MGE barley futures settled four to 10 cents per cwt higher, with May up five cents at $6.70.
